title: Remember when newly released champions used to be basic?
body: Now they come equipped with auto and melee abilities. A perma stun. A gun. A sword. ETC

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=cGzWaJoyce,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bROXN2A8,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-11-25T21:45:14.631+0000)
>
> just look at {{champion:142}} or {{champion:235}}

Those 2 are insanely overloaded.

Senna's also overtuned.
As games evolve, they up the ante, all updating games do this, from card games to fighting games.

There was Ivern who people played a little because he was busted then he got nerfed and abandoned because if a champion is simple it means they have few options and if those few options arent busted there is no reason to play them. Oh Aurelion Sol was simple too! Oh same fate as Ivern? Well shit.
Remember when people leveled up their accounts instead of buying botted ones?

I'd say every champion released before Thresh was somewhat basic.
You mean when Riot was shitting out champions every 2 weeks which gave us shit like Shyvana?
aphelios is very basic you deplete a gun and he grabs the next one

>A gun. A sword. ETC

whoa, characters going to a fight with _weapons_?  Madness!

I mean, when Yummi was released, people shit talked her for being too similar to Soraka and Sona ( boy were they wrong) A while after Morde was released, people complained he's boring and too binary to play unlike old (more complicated) morde.
There's only so much you can do with simple kits.

You think this game would survive without mobility?

Take out every extremely mobile champion in the game. You just removed 75% of the playerbase. GG
We just gonna ignore Neeko, Kayle, Morgana, Yuumi, and Pantheon? Even Senna is pretty simple in terms of gameplay mechanics, although her spells require some reading.
